lead_paragraph: The sedative known as midazolam has been at the center of botched executions in several states, including a 2014 lethal-injection death in Arizona that took nearly two hours.

headline.print_headline: Arizona to Drop Drug Tied to Botched Executions
headline.main: Arizona Agrees to Stop Using Drug Tied to Botched Executions

snippet: The sedative known as midazolam has been at the center of botched executions in several states, including a 2014 lethal-injection death in Arizona that took nearly two hours....
abstract: Arizona Dept of Corrections agrees to stop using lethal-injection drug known as midazolam following controversy over botched or prolonged executions in several states; drug was used in 2014 execution of Joseph R Wood III, which took nearly two hours.
